data.title: 以至少 50 个字回答问题
data.content: "Describe one of your guiding principles or beliefs that helps you decide what to do in life. Explain your reasons for using this principle to guide your decisions."
data.answer: When it comes to one of my guiding principles that helps me decide what to do in life, I suppose it would be, "Are you more knowledgeable than you were yesterday?" By asking this question myself every single day, I have the opportunity to get a deep insight into myself, and it motivates me to study harder and work harder on a daily basis. I always have the belief that one should never stop learning until his death. This is particularly true for both children and young adults, while they still have the ability to learn fast. By the time they get to their middle age, they will be rather knowledgeable. (111 words)
